title: File System Monitoring Queue Overflow

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

activities.message:
Thanks a lot for reporting this potential issue back to us. We take security very seriously and would appreciate if you would not share any information about this bug until we have determined a potential patch.
 
Our security team will take a look at this issue as soon as possible. We will reply to your report within 72 hours, usually much faster.

Hi @ihsinme,

we discussed your reports and came to the conclusion that they are informative but not really critical in our point of view.
If you can show as a practical exploit (preferebly with a pov video) to those issues we can reevaluate but until then I will close your reports.

If you find any more issues feel free to open new reports.

Thanks,
Corby

Hi Corby.
Of the reports presented, it is easier to show on this.

In the video, I synchronize with your demo account and create several folders, some of them do not get into client processing. In non-synchronized folders, I can perform any action more aggressively. In the end, I wait for synchronization not due to changes in the file system and make sure that the folders do not appear in the client.

Other reports can also be demonstrated in a similar way, but they are more complex and less stable. If your experts are aware of the reality of the problems described in the reports and still consider these reports informative, then this probably makes no sense?

Thank you for your time.

Hi @ihsinme,

thanks for your video. We acknowledge the impact but the severity is not high enough in our opinion to classify this as a security issue.
We will take care of the bug.

Thanks,
Corby

thanks, I'm sorry.
Iâ€™m probably not experienced enough in assessing the severity of influence.

Dear Corby, all the same, sorry for my persistence. But I ask you to understand, I'm just starting to look for errors, and it is very important for me to understand the algorithm for evaluating my work.

I understand very well that you could put in place of "informatively" and "Spam" and "Not Applicable". Thank you for not setting. But still, I have a number of questions on all three of my reports. (881891, 881895, 878739).

Initially, you closed them all with the wording "informative but not really critical in our point of view" and I thought that the question was confirmation of the impact. But unfortunately, after watching the video, you agreed with the impact but pointed out the lack of "high enough" to classify as a security problem. I thought that it would be more correct to rely on CVSS v3.0 in the evaluation of "enough". Therefore, I reiterate below the rationale for my assessment of CVSS v3.0 for report 881891: CVSS: 3.0 / AV: L / AC: L / PR: L / UI: N / S: C / C: N / I: L / A: L.

Yes, in this assessment you can discuss PR: L or PR: H. But the impact on availability and integrity confirmed in the video does not exactly allow this assessment to fall below the average level, which is important for me.
I looked at your program again and there are lines describing both the low and very low levels. It turns out that in my report, in your opinion, it is below a very low level.

I ask you to understand correctly, I am very grateful to you for the time spent on me and would not like to abuse it, but it is really important for me to understand the principles of evaluations from yours for further development.

Thank you for your time.

Hi @ihsinme,

okay let me try to explain.
I acknowledge the impact, by that I meant that I acknowledge that there is a bug (not yet a security issue).
Furthermore yes, this issue has an impact on the availability of the system but only to the local owncloud client process. There is no loss of data, no corruption or modification of data. Also or your exploit to work, as you have shown, the attacker has to have local access. But with local access an attacker could do much more damage, than just blocking the sync, like deleting, modifying the files. etc.

I hope you understand.

Thanks for asking,
Corby

Hi Corby.  
Thank you so much for the answer. In general, I agree with you in your reasoning. But it would be great if you told me where I am mistaken, I will start from the end of your answer:   
1.   
```  
Also or your exploit to work, as you have shown, the attacker has to have local access. But with local access an attacker could do much more damage, than just blocking the sync, like deleting, modifying the files. etc.  
```  
It is absolutely true, but this circumstance cannot block attributing the error to the security problem. Otherwise, it would not have been in the specification of the "Common Vulnerability Scoring System v3.0".  
```  
Local (L) A vulnerability exploitable with Local access means that the vulnerable component is not bound to the network stack, and the attacker's path is via read / write / execute capabilities. In some cases, the attacker may be logged in locally in order to exploit the vulnerability, otherwise, she may rely on User Interaction to execute a malicious file.  
```  
Regarding the fact that you can delete, modify files with local access, is also absolutely true, but in this case the threat model will not be associated with your software.  
Yes, you may not consider this level, but this exception is not described in your program. Therefore, sending you a report, I could not know that this could lead to the status of "informatively low." Moreover, looking at your work with researcher Florian Bogner (fbogner) in 2016 (https://hackerone.com/reports/155657), I could assume that the local threat model is interesting to you and is being evaluated.  
2.  
```  
Furthermore yes, this issue has an impact on the availability of the system but only to the local owncloud client process. There is no loss of data, no corruption or modification of data.  
```  
I have to apologize, but I do not agree. When the queue is blocked, different nuggetes of files are recorded on the server and the local client (these can be unrecorded changes, deleted files, or deleted files). In addition, we must take into account that the client uses cloud storage from different devices, as a rule, this leads to a change in the general data. Therefore, the loss and modification of data is possible. But again referring to the specification, we see that the loss of integrity is understood including:  
```  
Integrity refers to the trustworthiness and veracity of information.  
```  
And the point of impact I have chosen as low describes just our situation:  
```  
Modification of data is possible, but the attacker does not have control over the consequence of a modification, or the amount of modification is constrained. The data modification does not have a direct, serious impact on the impacted component.  
```   
  
  
In the end, I sincerely want to individually thank you Corby for the answers. This is really important to me and at the moment it is the only thing that can be called positive from my attempt to improve your software.  

I will look forward to your reply.

Hi @ihsinme,

I didn't mean `local` always equals low impact.
The difference between your report and his is that he injected code wich is then executed by the ownCloud client with elevated priviliges. He could gain access to the user credentials or something in that category which would result in account take over.

With the issue you reported on the other hand there is no higher damage. If your script is stopped and the ownCloud process is restarted the syncing works again and no files are lost.
Or the user could still access the ownCloud via a webbrowser.
I do not quite agree with you. But anyway, thanks for the experience.
